intro: Anchusa undulata subsp. lamprocarpa, commonly known as the silverleaf anchusa, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Its subspecies distinction is based on morphological differences in leaf structure and flower coloration.
